Welcome to the stick center-calibration: Welcome to the stick center-calibration wizard!
This tool will guide you in re-centering: This tool will guide you in re-centering the analog sticks of your controller. It consists of four steps: you will be asked to move both sticks in a direction and release them.
Please be aware that, <i>once the calibr: Please be aware that, once the calibration is running, it cannot be canceled. Do not close this page or disconnect your controller until it is completed.
Please move both sticks to the <b>top-le: Please move both sticks to the top-left corner and release them.
When the sticks are back in the center,: When the sticks are back in the center, press Continue.
Please move both sticks to the <b>top-ri: Please move both sticks to the top-right corner and release them.
Please move both sticks to the <b>bottom: Please move both sticks to the bottom-left corner and release them.
Please move both sticks to the bottom-right corner and release them.
Please do not close this window and do n: Please do not close this window and do not disconnect your controller.

Just few things to know before you can s: Just few things to know before you can start:
This website is not affiliated with Sony: This website is not affiliated with Sony, PlayStation & co.
This service is provided without warrant: This service is provided without warranty. Use at your own risk.
Keep the internal battery of the control: Keep the internal battery of the controller connected and ensure it is well charged. If the battery dies during operations, the controller will be damaged and rendered unusable.
Before doing the permanent calibration,: Before doing the permanent calibration, try the temporary one to ensure that everything is working well.
Welcome to the F.A.Q. section! Below, yo: Welcome to the F.A.Q. section! Below, you'll find answers to some of the most commonly asked questions about this website. If you have any other inquiries or need further assistance, feel free to reach out to me directly. Your feedback and questions are always welcome!
Behind the scenes, this website is the c: Behind the scenes, this website is the culmination of one year of dedicated effort in reverse-engineering DualShock controllers for fun/hobby from a random guy on the internet.
, it was discovered that there exist som: , it was discovered that there exist some undocumented commands on DualShock controllers that can be sent via USB and are used during factory assembly process. If these commands are sent, the controller starts the recalibration of analog sticks.
While the primary focus of this research: While the primary focus of this research wasn't initially centered on recalibration, it became apparent that a service offering this capability could greatly benefit numerous individuals. And thus, here we are.
Does the calibration remain effective du: Does the calibration remain effective during gameplay on PS4/PS5?
Yes, if you tick the checkbox \"Write ch: Yes, if you tick the checkbox "Write changes permanently in the controller". In that case, the calibration is flashed directly in the controller firmware. This ensures that it remains in place regardless of the console it's connected to.
Is this an officially endorsed service?: Is this an officially endorsed service?
No, this service is simply a creation by: No, this service is simply a creation by a DualShock enthusiast.
Does this website detect if a controller: Does this website detect if a controller is a clone?
Yes, only DualShock4 at the moment. This: Yes, only DualShock4 at the moment. This happened because I accidentally purchased some clones, spent time identifying the differences and added this functionality to prevent future deception.
Unfortunately, the clones cannot be cali: Unfortunately, the clones cannot be calibrated anyway, because they only clone the behavior of a DualShock4 during normal gameplay, not all the undocumented functionalities.
If you want to extend this detection fun: If you want to extend this detection functionality to DualSense, please ship me a fake DualSense and you'll see it in few weeks.
I maintain two separate to-do lists for: I maintain two separate to-do lists for this project, although the priority has yet to be established.
The first list is about enhancing suppor: The first list is about enhancing support for DualShock4 and DualSense controllers:
Improve detection of clones, particularl: Improve detection of clones, particularly beneficial for those seeking to purchase used controllers with assurance of authenticity.
Enhance user interface (e.g. provide add: Enhance user interface (e.g. provide additional controller information)
Additionally, explore the possibility of: Additionally, explore the possibility of reviving non-functioning DualShock controllers (further discussion available on Discord for interested parties).
The second list contains new controllers: The second list contains new controllers I aim to support:
Each of these tasks presents both immens: Each of these tasks presents both immense interest and significant time investment. To provide context, supporting a new controller typically demands 6-12 months of full-time research, alongside a stroke of good fortune.
I love this service, it helped me! How c: I love this service, it helped me! How can I contribute?
I'm glad to hear that you found this hel: I'm glad to hear that you found this helpful! If you're interested in contributing, here are a few ways you can help me:
to support my late-night caffeine-fueled: to support my late-night caffeine-fueled reverse-engineering efforts.
Ship me a controller you would love to a: Ship me a controller you would love to add (send me an email for organization).
Translate this website in your language: Translate this website in your language
, to help more people like you!: , to help more people like you!
This website uses analytics to improve t: This website uses analytics to improve the service.
Please let me know if the board model of: Please let me know if the board model of your controller is not detected correctly.
This DualSense controller has outdated f: This DualSense controller has outdated firmware.
Please update the firmware and try again: Please update the firmware and try again.
Can I reset a permanent calibration to p: Can I reset a permanent calibration to previous calibration?
Can you overwrite a permanent calibratio: Can you overwrite a permanent calibration?
Yes. Simply do another permanent calibra: Yes. Simply do another permanent calibration.
Stickdrift is caused by a physical defec: Stickdrift is caused by a physical defect; namely dirt, worn potentiometer or in some cases a worn spring.
This software will not fix stick drift o: This software will not fix stick drift on its own if you already experience that. What it will help with, is ensuring the new joystick(s) will function properly after replacing the old one(s) to work well with.
I have noticed some controllers out of t: I have noticed some controllers out of the box have worse factory calibration than if I would recalibrate them. Especially true for circularity of SCUF controllers with a unique shell.
(Dualsense) Will updating the firmware r: (Dualsense) Will updating the firmware reset calibration?
After range calibration, joysticks alway: After range calibration, joysticks always go in corners.
This issue happens because you have clic: This issue happens because you have clicked "Done" immediately after starting a range calibration.
You have to rotate the joysticks before: You have to rotate the joysticks before you press "Done".
Make sure to touch the edges of the joys: Make sure to touch the edges of the joystick frame and rotate slowly, preferably in each direction - clockwise and anti-clockwise.
Only after you have done that, you click: Only after you have done that, you click on "Done".
Please connect a DualShock 4, a DualSens: Please connect a DualShock 4, a DualSense or DualSense Edge controller to your computer and press Connect.
The device is connected via Bluetooth. D: The device is connected via Bluetooth. Disconnect and reconnect using a USB cable instead.
Range calibration appears to have failed: Range calibration appears to have failed. Please try again and make sure you rotate the sticks.
A reboot is needed to continue using thi: A reboot is needed to continue using this DualSense Edge. Please disconnect and reconnect your controller.
Move the sticks continuously in circles: Move the sticks continuously in circles for accurate polling rate measurement.
Move the stick to select it for tuning,: Move the stick to select it for tuning, then without touching the stick use the D-pad buttons to adjust the center point. Flick it and adjust it again if it is off center or flickers.
Please release the stick to center posit: Please release the stick to center position before adjusting with D-pad buttons.
Press the D-pad or face buttons in the d: Press the D-pad or face buttons in the direction you want the stick position to move.
While holding the stick to be adjusted s: While holding the stick to be adjusted straight up/down/left/right, make adjustments until you see lightblue sectors in all four directions after circling the stick both left and right. Then use the
<strong>Average circularity error:</stro: Average circularity error: smaller is not always better! Aim for 7-9 %.
Sony controllers come from the factory c: Sony controllers come from the factory calibrated to have an average circularity error of nearly 10 %, and this is now what games expect. Too perfect circularity can make movements and aim feel stiff and unresponsive in some games.
Push the stick straight up/down/left/rig: Push the stick straight up/down/left/right as far as possible.
Rotate the sticks slowly at least 2 time: Rotate the sticks slowly at least 2 times in one direction and 2 times in the other direction to cover the whole range.
The <b>Done</b> button will unlock after: The Done button will unlock after at most 15 seconds. If you press Done without rotating the sticks, the calibration will be incomplete and you will need to repeat it.
Calibration is being stored in the stick: Calibration is being stored in the stick modules.
Support for calibrating DualSense Edge s: Support for calibrating DualSense Edge stick modules is now available as an experimental feature.
Please note: the stick modules on the DS: Please note: the stick modules on the DS Edge cannot be calibrated via software alone.
To store a custom calibration on the sti: To store a custom calibration on the stick's internal memory, a hardware modification is required.
This involves temporarily disabling writ: This involves temporarily disabling write protection by applying +1.8V to a specific test point on each module.
You can do this in two ways:: You can do this in two ways:
<b>Internally</b>: by soldering a wire f: Internally: by soldering a wire from a +1.8V source to the write-protect TP.
<b>Externally</b>: by applying +1.8V dir: Externally: by applying +1.8V directly to the visible test point without opening the controller.
This is only for advanced users. If you': This is only for advanced users. If you're not sure what you're doing, please do not attempt it.
We are not responsible for any damage ca: We are not responsible for any damage caused by attempting this modification.
For more info or help, feel free to reac: For more info or help, feel free to reach out on Discord.
If the calibration is not stored permane: If the calibration is not stored permanently, please double-check the wirings of the hardware mod.
You can now close this window.
AB Control Hub is an advanced, free web-: AB Control Hub is an advanced, free web-based tool designed to diagnose, test, and calibrate Sony PlayStation controllers directly from your browser. Whether you are experiencing analog stick drift or just want to check your controller's input latency, this tool provides a comprehensive solution without downloading any software.
Permanently fix stick drift on DualSense: Permanently fix stick drift on DualSense and DualShock 4.
Measure Polling Rate (Hz), Input Latency: Measure Polling Rate (Hz), Input Latency (ms), and Jitter.
Test Vibration motors, Adaptive Triggers: Test Vibration motors, Adaptive Triggers, and LED colors.
Read battery level, firmware version, an: Read battery level, firmware version, and hardware details.
* Note: Requires a browser with WebHID s: * Note: Requires a browser with WebHID support (Chrome, Edge, Opera).
Cookie Banner Text: This website uses cookies to ensure you get the best experience on our website.
AB Control Hub Description: AB Control Hub is an advanced, free web-based tool designed to diagnose, test, and calibrate Sony PlayStation controllers directly from your browser. Whether you are experiencing stick drift or just want to check your controller's input latency, this tool provides a comprehensive solution without downloading any software.
Drift Calibration Feature: Permanently fix stick drift on DualSense and DualShock 4.
Input Analysis Feature: Measure Polling Rate (Hz), Input Latency (ms), and Jitter.
Output Testing Feature: Test Vibration motors, Adaptive Triggers, and LED colors.
Device Info Feature: Read battery level, firmware version, and hardware details.
WebHID Requirement: * Note: Requires a browser with WebHID support (Chrome, Edge, Opera).

AB Control Hub is the ultimate Web-Based: AB Control Hub is the ultimate Web-Based tool to test and calibrate PlayStation controllers (DualSense & DualShock 4). Fix analog stick drift, measure input latency, and test buttons online without installing software.
We are always striving to improve your e: We are always striving to improve your experience, share your opinion or report a problem.

At AB Control Hub, your privacy is our t: At AB Control Hub, your privacy is our top priority. This Privacy Policy explains how we handle your data when you use our web-based controller calibration tool.
AB Control Hub does not collect, store,: AB Control Hub does not collect, store, or transmit any personal data.
All communication with your controller h: All communication with your controller happens locally on your device using the WebHID API. Your button presses, stick movements, and controller serial numbers never leave your browser.
We use essential cookies only to store y: We use essential cookies only to store your preferences, such as your selected language and whether you have accepted our terms. These cookies are stored locally on your device.
We may use basic analytics (like Google: We may use basic analytics (like Google Analytics) to understand how the site is used and improve the service. These services may collect anonymous data such as your browser type and general location (country), but no personally identifiable information.
We may update our Privacy Policy from ti: We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page.
By accessing and using AB Control Hub, y: By accessing and using AB Control Hub, you accept and agree to be bound by the terms and provision of this agreement.
The software is provided \"as is\", with: The software is provided "as is", without warranty of any kind. Calibration operations involve writing to the controller's firmware. While this tool is tested, the user assumes all risks associated with firmware modifications.
AB Control Hub and its developer shall n: AB Control Hub and its developer shall not be liable for any damages, including but not limited to controller damage, data loss, or bricked devices resulting from the use or inability to use this tool.
Calibration is a sensitive process. Ensu: Calibration is a sensitive process. Ensure your controller is connected via a stable USB cable and has sufficient battery charge before proceeding with permanent changes.
AB Control Hub is the ultimate Web-Based: AB Control Hub is the ultimate Web-Based tool to test and calibrate PlayStation controllers.
AB Control Hub is an independent tool an: AB Control Hub is an independent tool and is not affiliated with, endorsed by, or associated with Sony Interactive Entertainment, PlayStation, or any of its subsidiaries.
